meanings.definition: A book with flexible covers made of paper or card.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading softcovers because they are easier to hold.
meanings.sent2: The library had a wide selection of softcovers for me to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The softcovers on the books felt like gentle hugs when I picked them up.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of softcovers was a colorful garden blooming on the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The softcovers of the books whispered stories of faraway lands.

meanings.definition: To cover with a soft material.
meanings.sent1: She carefully softcovers the baby with a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent2: The tailor softcovers the sofa with plush fabric.
meanings.sent3: He softcovers his phone with a fluffy case to protect it.
meanings.sent4: The snow softcovers the ground like a white blanket.
meanings.sent5: The artist softcovers the canvas with delicate strokes of paint.
